item.title: Pentagon probing how Ukraine war document marked top-secret appeared online
item.description: An official said the Pentagon is trying to determine how the material leaked and how serious the leak is.

item.title: Pentagon investigates leak of Ukrainian military plans
item.description: The Pentagon is investigating a leak of classified information regarding the plans of Ukrainian forces in their fight against Russia. David Martin has more.

item.title: Several killed in suspected Palestinian terror attacks in West Bank, Tel Aviv
item.description: Multiple people were killed in two suspected terror attacks Friday by Palestinian militants in Tel Aviv and the West Bank Friday, as violence continues to escalate in the region. Israel also Friday launched airstrikes in southern Lebanon and the Gaza Strip. Imtiaz Tyab has the latest.

item.title: Pope Francis misses Good Friday nighttime procession in cold Rome
item.description: The 86-year-old pope was discharged from a Rome hospital on Saturday after being administered antibiotics intravenously for bronchitis.

item.title: Chocolate Easter bunnies made with ecstasy found at airport
item.description: Drugs have also been found hidden in toy chemistry sets, portraits of Jesus Christ, teddy bears and copper pipes.

item.title: Israel strikes Lebanon and Gaza as passover coincides with ramadan
item.description: Israeli jets have launched a series of strikes on what it says are terrorist targets in Gaza and Lebanon. The military action has already triggered a volley of rocket launches from Gaza this morning mounting tension ahead of Friday prayers. Ian Lee reports.

item.title: Jailed Wall Street Journal reporter charged with espionage, Russian media says
item.description: Two Russian news agencies say Evan Gershkovich has been formally charged with espionage in Russia and has entered an official denial.

item.title: Paul Cattermole of British pop group S Club 7 dies at age 46
item.description: In 2002, the group performed at a Buckingham Palace concert to celebrate Queen Elizabeth II's 50 years on the throne.

item.title: Biden administration blames Trump in part for chaotic Afghanistan withdrawal
item.description: The White House blamed former President Donald Trump for two factors that played a major role in the withdrawal of U.S. troops in 2021.

item.title: Israel says 2 killed in shooting as it strikes Hamas in Lebanon and Gaza
item.description: The exchange of fire across the Lebanon border marked a risky escalation of an already-tense situation, as two people were killed in a suspected terror attack in the West Bank.

item.title: Lifeboat, door found in hunt for Japanese army copter feared down at sea
item.description: The country's defense chief said the army would "do our utmost for the rescue of the 10 people who are still missing."

item.title: Chinese man jailed for abusing woman seen chained up in viral video
item.description: A court said years of abuse had left the woman, who was sold 3 times to various people, with schizophrenia.

item.title: What's so fancy about "the world's most advanced train station"?
item.description: A new wing of Osaka Station in western Japan offers facial recognition ticketing, reconfigurable sliding barriers, and even real-time bathroom updates.

item.title: Israel conducts airstrikes on Gaza as violence escalates
item.description: Israeli forces conducted airstrikes on the Gaza Strip after militants in Lebanon fired rockets into northern Israel. It all follows several days of violence and unrest in Jerusalem. Imtiaz Tyab has the latest from the region.

item.title: King Charles III supports investigation into monarchy's links to slavery
item.description: In his recent memoir "Spare," Prince Harry wrote that the monarchy rests upon wealth generated by "exploited workers and thuggery, annexation and enslaved people."

item.title: Israeli police clash with Palestinian worshippers
item.description: Israeli police clash with Palestinian worshippers for a second night. Violence flared up at the Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem. Charlie D'Agata reports.

item.title: Marburg virus: What to know about this lethal cousin of Ebola
item.description: Marburg virus causes severe viral hemorrhagic fever and 24% to 88% of people who contracted the disease in different outbreaks died.

item.title: Pilot finds cobra under seat, makes emergency landing: "I kept looking down"
item.description: Rudolf Erasmus had four passengers on board when he felt "something cold" slide across his lower back

item.title: Jacinda Ardern delivers emotional final speech to New Zealand Parliament
item.description: Jacinda Ardern announced her resignation as prime minister in January after more than five years as New Zealand's leader – and now has her sights set on combating environmental issues and online extremism.

item.title: CDC issues alert amid Marburg virus outbreak abroad
item.description: Health authorities in Africa have been battling two unprecedented outbreaks of the Ebola-like viral hemorrhagic fever.

item.title: Israel says rockets fired from Lebanon after clashes at Jerusalem mosque
item.description: The Palestinian Red Crescent said six people were injured in the fresh clashes, which were less violent than the previous night.

item.title: French president turns to China to push for Russia-Ukraine peace
item.description: The Kremlin, however, rejected any idea of Chinese mediation on Thursday, saying it's not the time for a political solution in Ukraine.

item.title: Remains of Michigan airman killed in World War II identified 79 years later
item.description: Lieutenant Peter A. Timpo was 24 when he was assigned to the 343rd Bombardment Squadron in the summer of 1943.

item.title: China vows "forceful measures" in response to U.S.-Taiwan meeting
item.description: Beijing has already sailed warships close to the self-governed island, and one analyst says there's "absolutely no doubt" a response is coming.

item.title: 3 family members charged with human smuggling, forced labor at Massachusetts restaurants
item.description: The men were first charged by authorities in October, but new charges were announced in April.

item.title: Foreign Affairs committee chair leads bipartisan delegation to Taiwan
item.description: The trip comes on the heels of House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's meeting with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-Wen in California.

item.title: Black Hawk helicopter carrying 10 crashes into ocean, Japan's army says
item.description: The UH-60JA Black Hawk helicopter disappeared from radar while on a reconnaissance mission, officials said.

item.title: Man charged after taking platypus on shopping trip; animal's fate a mystery
item.description: Authorities cautioned that the missing animal — which may be venomous — could be in danger.

item.title: China scores new diplomatic victory as Iran, Saudis push reconciliation
item.description: The long-time rivals reportedly agreed to reopen diplomatic missions in each other's capitals and will consider resuming direct flights – progress brokered by Beijing.

item.title: King Charles III's coronation introduces "Queen Camilla"
item.description: The wife of King Charles III will attend his coronation next month under the title "Queen Camilla," rather than her current title of "queen consort."
